alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 10:26PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MDT/230 AM CDT/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast New Mexico and southwest Texas, including the following counties, in southeast New Mexico, Eddy. In southwest Texas, Culberson. * WHEN...Until 130 AM MDT /230 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1026 PM MDT /1126 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pine Springs, Guadalupe Mountains National Park, McKittrick Canyon, Carlsbad Caverns National Park and Lincoln National Forest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
